intro: Saxifraga sternbergii, commonly known as the desert saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats of foliage, often with succulent leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and early summer. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities. Saxifraga sternbergii is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
